intro: Bhesa archboldiana, commonly known as the Archbold's bhesa, is a rare and endemic plant species found exclusively in the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and possesses small, elongated leaves with a waxy surface to reduce water loss. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow flowers during the dry season, which are pollinated by specific insect species. Its unique adaptations to high-altitude environments make it a subject of interest for botanists studying plant resilience. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Bhesa archboldiana is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
